title: Vayne Jungle-Its Real
body:
So, recently I tryed vayne jungle after seeing it in an anklespankin video. Its actually pretty cool.

{{champion:67}}  

**Items**
{{item:3726}} Or {{item:3710}}  (One for stronger Ganks, Other for better farming)
After buy regular items.
**Jungling**
Max W first for Max Hp% damage vs monsters.
Use Q&E To kite jungle monsters.
Start at krugs, smite for buff.
**Ganks**
Q in, then E the enemy laner into your laner, only stun if you can push them back while doing it. 
Enjoy!

replies.body: It works, but be prepared to get raged on, blamed, and griefed by your own team(doesn't matter how well you do).  The community dives on meta-breaking like a pack of vultures :(
Thats why i used team builder-I waited for a team that accepted me.

> [{quoted}](name=ladention,realm=NA,application-id=WEuoGbmp,discussion-id=iHWPaukW,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-01-05T23:58:30.847+0000)
>
> Thats why i used team builder-I waited for a team that accepted me.

Did the same with jungle Jinx, took forever though
It definitely reduces it, but you'd be amazed how many people still jump into the standard slew of blame despite seeing and accepting the team already hehe

Question: how would the team build around a Vayne Jungle? I would imagine cc heavy top and support and probably ap mid (Fizz maybe) and a multi-purposed ADC(Ezreal or Corki). Besides that, I would like to know your thoughts and opinions about this because breaking meta yet discovering and improving new method would keep this format of games interesting.

I find it works really well with a semi mobile adc, and like you said, cc.  The best part about having extra cc is it makes setting up lockdowns with the condemn becomes much, much easier.  For the adc, Corki or Trist will be able to take maximum advantage of your ganks with dashes, and Jinx creates hell for them once the cc train starts(which she often begins with her own slow).

Mid is a hard lane for her to gank if they ward properly(her ult only closes so much distance and there are not many condemn areas, and she's squishy), so someone who can do well without much assistance would be best there.  If they have reliable cc, however, it becomes doable without too much risk.

Top seems like a toss up.  I haven't had the same top laner twice so far with her, but basically anyone with decent cc and some tankiness should work well enough with her. 

I think the biggest thing that gets overlooked when playing an odd squishy jungler is that the team needs some initiation/tankiness elsewhere.
I guess an alternative for Mid laners would be Anivia with it's wall/condemn combo, but there needs to be a good level of synergy.

Good idea :)

Always like a good Anivia too.

Top/support/mid (one of them) must be a tanky initiator. Having 3 incredibly squishy people on your team leads to a deficiency of people to make up the front line that protects the back line, or there's just top lane/tank support and everyone else behind him -- really not a good idea.

After you find your top/support/galio, you need to make sure that your team has enough CC to go around to make up for Vayne's relative lack of it and squishiness. Think of vayne as a really squishy Fiora in teamfights. She doesn't have CC, so bring some of your own to the table.

TL;DR bring a tank and some CC
